Message.Title: Obama policy grows gaps between haves and have nots in home ownership.
Message.Msg: No doubt about it, due to the legacy our founders left us, the average MODERN American still has more freedom and a higher standard of living than probably 97% of the people who have ever lived on this earth. Home ownership: I just sold a house to a young couple, it was at a fair retail price, probably saved them about 5% because they were referred to me by a friend so no sales commission was involved. They thanked me about a dozen times for "working with them" and "being patient with them", and they were prequalified, deal to closing was less than 5 weeks. What they meant is this, young couples who have good jobs and qualify for mortgages can't get a good deal. So many people cannot qualify for mortgages that many of the better quality entry level houses as sold cash to investors as rentals. They had been looking for two years and 6 months seriously. His aunt was a real estate agent who handled this transaction for them for free (at least nothing to me or recorded). They said that anytime they found a really nice house, close to fairly priced for the market, their bid was not considered, especially if bank owned and a bid that was assured for cash (sometimes even lower) was accepted. That problem could have been remedied 2-3 years ago. I have asked how so many with decent jobs, both of a couple working cannot get a $750 PITI mortgage but can afford to pay $1000 rent for month after month. I thought my case may be isolated because of location, but the WSJ ran a story saying the same thing last week, so it's got to be fairly common. The remaining Obama believers think he is progressive and a populist, which is a fa√ßade lie like most other things coming from this administration.

Message.Title: Bestselling Laptop
Message.Msg: Amazon's #1 bestselling laptop does not run Windows 8. It's the Samsung Google Chromebook running Chrome OS and NO Metro Tiles! I'm using mine right now. Boots in only 7 seconds to the world's most popular browser Google Chrome. I have access to Google Docs, so I don't need Microsoft Office. Thin and light at only 2.4 lbs. 6.5 hrs of battery life too. Forget about big heavy 15 inch $500 laptops running Windows 8. The Samsung Google Chromebook is lighter, faster and cheaper at half the price.

Topic.Title: Any math people out there?

Message.Msg: " I WAS OFF THE TOP A LITTLE OVER A YEAR....BUT CERTAINLY NO 986. 2 WRONG DON'T MAKE IT RIGHT. BUT.. 986 IS WAAAAAAAY WRONG" No, math moe, I said 459 days to delisting for $100 stock, exactly right for full days since one cannot round down and 986 days assume $100 or achieving less than 1/2% for percentages. You were not remotely close saying that would decline it nearly 1000%, a common mistake for those with no training. Leave math to adults who have been educated. The only mistake I made was not re reading the problem to 100% rather than $100 already admitted. I said (assuming $100): 'If you consider rounding to the nearest penny as zero for stock purposes it would be there in 986 days, but would be delisted earlier after 459 days when it dropped below a buck."

Message.Title: Say XBox On
Message.Msg: You walk in the room and say XBOX on. You then get logged on by facial recognition. No hands so far. Say find Redskins VS Cowboys. It finds the game for you. You notice it looks different but better. That is because of the exclusive NFL content deal. Maybe you want to check out the Steven Spielberg exclusive show based on halo. Say Stephen Spielberg exclusive or whatever the hell they call it. Now you want to check a couple stocks and everyone in the room is talking so you pick up your Microsoft Phone and enter and navigate the quotes in the corner of the screen while the game still plays. You get a blu ray player, XBOX music & Windows 8 app. You can run the apps right on your big screen tv. Wait it says incoming call from Susy. You say answer call and you are in a HD Skype group conference call right in your living room. Pretty exciting. It is XBOX ONE.

Topic.Title: IF YOU REALLY WANT TO KNOW...COMPARE PS4 AND XBOX AT GIZMADO. IT'S A DETAILED COMP. VERY GOOD. BOTTOM LINE.

Message.Msg: For now, there is just no getting around the PlayStation's less fumbling rollout. All of the Xbox One's good qualities‚Äîease of use in your home, Kinect magnificence, cloud rendering, possibly super easy trade-ins once the license stuff gets sorted out‚Äîare off in the future. They're distinct possibilities, but the PS4 is the bird in the hand right now. It's not made of a bunch of hypothetical parts that may or may not come together. Just know that if everything does work out for Microsoft, it's going to be a very impressive alternative.
